intro: Calyptrogyne teres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, waxy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant thrives in saline or brackish environments, often found in mangrove swamps and salt marshes. Its flowers are typically tubular with five lobes and are adapted for pollination by insects. Calyptrogyne teres plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
